intro: Rosa floriana, commonly known as the florid rose, is a species native to the mountainous regions of Central and South America. It is a deciduous shrub characterized by its fragrant, semi-double pink flowers that bloom in late spring to early summer. The plant has dark green, serrated leaves and produces hips that are red and edible. Rosa floriana thrives in well-drained soil and partial to full sunlight, making it a popular choice for ornamental gardening. Its botanical features make it both aesthetically pleasing and ecologically valuable in its native habitat.
